newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH AUG REAL INDUSTRIAL OUTPUT UP 5.8 PCT YR/YR.
newsitem.headline: CZECH AUG REAL INDUSTRIAL OUTPUT UP 5.8 PCT YR/YR.

text.p: Czech real industrial ouput in August grew by 5.8 percent in August, compared with the same month in 1995, the Czech Statistical Bureau (CSU) said on Thursday.

That compares with a real, inflation adjusted, rise of just 15.6 percent in July, which was skewed by having three extra working days that accounted for about 7.9 percentage points of the year-on-year increase.
For the first eight months of 1996, real industrial production has risen 8.6 percent, year-on-year, and real wages were up 7.8 percent.
It said average nominal monthly wages grew 15.1 percent in August, year-on-year, compared with a 19.7 percent in July, with real wages 5.0 percent higher than the same month in 1995.
The average nominal industrial wage in was 9,307 crowns compared with 9,633 in July.
The wage results sample companies with 100 or more employees while output results include estimates of smaller firms as well.
